main event: A large, yellow object was observed at a very high altitude in Tarrytown, New York on 8 August 1956, moving slowly to the southeast and appearing 5 to 6 times larger than the North Star.
interesting points: The observation was made by a Police Sgt.
The object remained in sight for an indefinite period, suggesting a prolonged sighting.
Mars was suggested as a possible explanation for the object's appearance and movement.
The report concluded that there was insufficient data for evaluation, leaving the nature of the object unexplained.
The sighting coincided with a prevalent astrological phenomenon at that time of year.
sighted object: large, yellow object at very high altitude
